sections.heading: 1. Who We Are
content: This website is operated by KalmKatz (KalmKatz.co.uk) ("we", "us", "our"). We are the data controller responsible for personal data collected through this website.
If you have any questions about this policy or your data, you can contact us at: info@kalmkatz.co.uk

sections.heading: 2. What Data We Collect
content: When you visit our website, we collect limited technical information via JavaScript and secure server logging. This may include:
list: IP address
Date and time of visit
Browser type and version
Operating system
Referring website or source (where you came from)
Pages accessed
Approximate geographic location (derived from IP address)
Technical indicators used to determine whether a visitor is human, automated, or potentially malicious
contentAfter: We do not use cookies. We do not collect names, contact details, or account information unless you separately provide them to us.

sections.heading: 3. Why We Collect This Data
content: We process this information for the following purposes:
list: Analytics – to understand how visitors find our website and which marketing campaigns are effective
Business intelligence – to determine general geographic demand and identify legitimate customer regions
Security monitoring – to detect bots, attackers, and fraudulent activity
Abuse prevention and fraud detection – to protect our website and infrastructure
contentAfter: We are not interested in identifying individual visitors. Our focus is understanding traffic sources and protecting our systems.

sections.heading: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
content: We process this data under Legitimate Interests (Article 6(1)(f) UK GDPR).
list: Operating and improving our business
Measuring marketing effectiveness
Protecting our website from misuse, fraud, and malicious activity
contentAfter: We believe this processing is proportionate, minimal, and does not override your fundamental rights and freedoms.

sections.heading: 5. Data Retention
content: Raw technical logs are retained for a limited period for analytics and security purposes.
After this period, data is either:
list: Automatically deleted, or
Anonymised so that it can no longer identify any individual
contentAfter: Anonymised statistical data may be retained longer for business analysis.

sections.heading: 6. Data Sharing
content: We do not sell your data. We do not share your personal data with third parties for marketing purposes.
Data is processed on our secured VPS infrastructure. Access is restricted and protected using appropriate technical security measures.

sections.heading: 7. International Transfers
content: We do not intentionally transfer your personal data outside the United Kingdom unless required for infrastructure or hosting purposes, in which case appropriate safeguards will be in place.

sections.heading: 8. Your Rights
content: Under UK data protection law, you have the right to:
list: Request access to your personal data
Request correction of inaccurate data
Request erasure of your data
Request restriction of processing
Object to processing based on legitimate interests
Lodge a complaint with the Information Commissioner's Office
contentAfter: If you wish to exercise any of your rights, please contact us at: info@kalmkatz.co.uk
We may need to verify your identity before responding to requests.

sections.heading: 9. Security
content: We implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect data against unauthorised access, loss, misuse, or alteration.

sections.heading: 10. Changes to This Policy
content: We may update this policy from time to time. The latest version will always be available on this page.
